result.execSummary:
The defendant Sonya H Beckstrom was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (>1000-2500g) [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, On or Near a School], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)3.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

  Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process. 

 If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

records.addlTxt:
Reserve Judge Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV: 
[MK] case called at 11:17am. 
Defendant Sonya H Beckstrom in court, in custody, with Attorney David Zarwell.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing arguments given by ADA Hall, by Attorney Zarwell. 
Ms. Beckstrom makes a statement. 

On Count #4, the Court sentences Ms. Beckstrom to 3 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  18 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  18 months.  This sentence is to commence forthwith. 

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 The Court gives 169 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling as required by the Agent
--no contact with any known drug offenders except for purposes of treatment programs; an exception to this condition is that contact is allowed with Bradley Grout and with P.B.G. (dob 5/25/1999) 
--to submit to random urinalyses
--no purchase, possession, or consumption of alcohol
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to make diligent efforts to obtain/maintain employment and/or educational programming as approved by the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to pay the balance due on previously ordered costs, fees, and surcharges


Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess 11:30am

Case called at 9:57am [mo]
Defendant Sonya H Beckstrom in court with Attorney David Zarwell. ADA Monica J. Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for Branch IV

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #4; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #5 and #6
Arguments given by Counsel

On Count #4, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, with conditions:
--serve 120  days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release privileges; to commence on 4/10/2015 by 7:00 pm or earlier if approved by jail
--No Contact with any known drug offender, except for Bradley Grout and P.B.G. (dob 5/25/1999) and except for treatment purposes per agent
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Random urinalyses (not less than once per month for first 6 month upon release from jail)
--No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--No possession of any needles medically necessary and approved by agent 
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program, per Agent
--To submit DNA sample upon demand, unless previously provided
--To pay costs of $ 268 
--To pay $250 DNA surcharge 
--To pay $250 drug testing fee

Case called at 1:28 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Sonya H Beckstrom appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Svehlek informs the Court that Ms. Beckstrom is eligible for SPD Services
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient

Service of Complaint admitted; DOB & address confirmed accurate, but correct spelling of St. name is given; maximum penalties recited; reading waived
Court finds probable cause within the complaint to support Counts #4, #5 & #6
Bond arguments by Counsel

Court requires a $5000 signature bond, with conditions:
-Absolute sobriety
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-Take all prescription drugs as prescribed
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
-No possession of drug paraphernalia including needles unless needed for prescription medication
-No discussion of the facts of the case with co-defendant, Bradley Grout or her children
-Follow all family court orders

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties
